abstracts.cdata!:
The Protected Areas Management and
            Sustainable Use Project, will ensure the effective,
            long-term conservation of Uganda's biodiversity,
            through a sustainable, and cost-effective management of its
            wildlife, and cultural resources. To this end, the project
            components will: 1) fund the establishment of the Uganda
            Wildlife Authority (UWA), develop its internal systems,
            management team, and governance structure. A strategic plan
            was developed for the agency, which includes methodologies
            for facilitating the annual operating plans for the
            protected areas. The Global Environment Facility (GEF) share
            of this component reflects incremental costs for the
            administration of a protected area system, economically
            justified due to the competing land uses, and the basic
            needs of the relatively poor, rural population. The
            rationalization process involves the protection of the
            biodiversity heritage, and ecosystems, to provide sound
            basis for a sustainable tourism sector. The project will
            also ensure appropriate resettlement plans; 2) provide
            logistical support, equipment, and construction funds to
            establish new programs for environmental conservation
            education, to include a range of exhibits, and awareness
            campaigns, supporting biodiversity conservation; 3) provide
            training, management support, and technical capacity
            building, to enable the Wildlife Department implement its
            responsibilities under relevant international treaties,
            particularly to function s the management authority for the
            Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
            (CITES). Moreover, a sustainable tourism framework will be
            established, based on policy development, and an enabling
            legislation; and, 4) provide moderate, operational funds,
            equipment, and civil works to continue the establishment of
            the Uganda Museums and Monument Agency, to facilitate its
            offerings expansion, and identify new antiquarian sites.
